job_title: EVS Associate (Housekeeping) in Vaughan, ON
pros: unionized after 3 months. flexible schedule. paid training. higher pay than most jobs considering its very low requirements of simply an OSSD. 8 hours shifts, with 1 hour break (two 15min, one 30min).
cons: pay is lower than all other hospitals in the area for the same work. management is not pleasant, can be extremely rude and unprofessional. seniority is based on hours worked which is good but has drawbacks; like education levels play less of a role when applying to other internal positions. another important thing to note is work is not divided evenly at all -- so depending on ur shift you can be shafted with a lot for work for the same pay. management has in my experience done little to nothing to fix this although employees have been vocal about the issue. a lot of full time 8-4 staff get shafted with a lot of work. often short staffed on weekends and night shifts.

job_title: IT Support in Richmond Hill, ON
pros:
- Creative wellness initiatives
- Mostly good staff
- OK compensation
cons:
- Sub-par and immature management team that can only use threat of job loss to "motivate" employees

- Constructive criticism, governance and transparency look to need clarification for senior and middle management

- Nearly zero accountability for certain people, other long-term employees released at the drop of a hat

- Bad behaviour and policy violations not punished, and most often even rewarded

- HR not there for employees, won't enforce policy and often ignore major issues

- Compensation supposedly competitive but expectations 30% higher than competing facilities

- Hospital policies merely a suggestion, and contracts not worth the paper they're printed on

- High turnover and layoffs over the past two years nearly quarterly mostly due to management absolutely annihilating budgets

- Much of the staff looking to leave due to neglect and poor general culture

job_title: Clinical Extern in Richmond Hill, ON
pros:
- Relevant work & experience for nursing students, development of competence/skills/independence
- Shadowing or observing opportunities at other units
- Preceptor/mentor guidance
- Lots of support and interprofessional teamwork
- Good pay
- Breaks partially paid for
cons:
- Open availability for entire contract duration (4 months)
- No booked off time allowed
- Absences highly discouraged even if sick
- 12 hour shifts (7am-7pm or 7pm-7am)
- Switching from day shifts to night shifts in <12 hours (Day-Day-Night-Night)

job_title: Analyst in Richmond Hill, ON

cons: Management is brutal.  They don't care about their employees.  It's a trickle down effect that comes from the top.  Lack up support and trust. Everyone is always looking to leave.
